intro: Coreocarpus sonoranus, commonly known as the Sonoran coreocarpus, is a shrub native to the Sonoran Desert in North America. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, woody stems and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, oval fruits that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It is adapted to arid environments, with deep roots that allow it to access water from deeper soil layers. Coreocarpus sonoranus plays a role in providing habitat and food for various desert wildlife.
